definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Lotus Supercenter has been widely recognized by Shanghai people.
sentences.chinese: 易初蓮花購物中心已經被上海人普遍認可。

sentences.english: Luqing, can you go to shopping center?
sentences.chinese: 蘆青，這個星期你能去購物中心嗎？

sentences.english: Sakura Shopping Center is a good place to go shopping.
sentences.chinese: 櫻花購物中心是個購物的好地方。

sentences.english: A: There’s a big sale on clothes and sporting goods at Riverside Mall.
sentences.chinese: 河畔購物中心的衣服和運動器材大減價。

sentences.english: A similar trend can be seen in Irvine's new shopping centre.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的現象也出現於亞爾灣新建成的購物中心。

sentences.english: This is a boutique project for "karis" in a shopping center in Hiroshima.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個“卡利斯在廣島購物中心”的精品工程。

sentences.english: Located in the admiralty, it's more reminiscent of a hotel than a shopping mall.
sentences.chinese: 其坐落在金鐘，它更像一處酒店而非購物中心。

sentences.english: In Beijing, I usually go to the Financial Street Lane Crawford.
sentences.chinese: 在北京，我常去金融街購物中心的連卡佛。

sentences.english: The mall was opened along with the Venetian Hotel in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 購物中心於1999年與威尼斯人酒店一同開業。

sentences.english: They made the rounds of the shopping center.
sentences.chinese: 他們在購物中心一家店一家店地挨着逛。

sentences.english: Which way is the shopping mall, please?
sentences.chinese: 請問去大型購物中心的路怎麼走？

sentences.english: Mr. Riordan is a Trustee for Life of the International Council of Shopping Centers.
sentences.chinese: 澤爾丹先生是國際購物中心協會的終身理事。

sentences.english: I started my trip at the East Gate Shopping Mall.
sentences.chinese: 我的旅程是在東門購物中心開始的。

sentences.english: I try to visit a mall at every city while on tour.
sentences.chinese: 我會去逛每一個巡演所到城市的購物中心。

sentences.english: Those teenagers just hang around the mall with nothing to do.
sentences.chinese: 那些年輕人只是在購物中心閒逛，無所事事。

sentences.english: Everybody in Brewster is talking about the city's new shopping mall.
sentences.chinese: 布魯斯特家族的每一個人都在談論新的大型購物中心。

definition: shopping mall/shopping center/department store/emporium/CL:家[jia1]/the business world
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
